intro: Pleomele falsa, commonly known as false pleomele, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pink and are borne in terminal clusters, attracting various pollinators. Pleomele falsa is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in humid and tropical climates.
